lead_paragraph: ADAMS--Olive Arnold, 103, of New York City passed peacefully on March 24, 2016. Widow of Julius J. Adams, mother of Julie (Josiah) and Carolyn (Robert), grandmother of four and great-grandmother of three, she was the beloved matriarch of a large and loving clan of extended family and friends. Born in Anoka, Minnesota in 1912, she was the daughter of William J. and Marie Ellen (Parker) Arnold and the youngest of seven. With her husband in the 1950's, she created Global News Syndicate, empowering Negro journalists to impact the social and political scene, and in 1956 wrote "Time Bomb," an account of the Emmett Till murder. With her husband and daughters she established the Harlem Dance Foundation and the Central Harlem Brownstone Preservation Committee, which was instrumental in securing the landmark designation of the Mt. Morris Park neighborhood. She composed the musical "Santa Claus and the Unicorn," which was presented for 15 years at Aaron Davis Hall. For her 100th birthday, a children's reading bench was dedicated in her name in Mt. Morris Park. 1/3
